events.name: Kubernetes Singapore Birthday Event

venue.name: Google Singapore
venue.address_1: Level 29, Asia Square Tower 1, 8 Marina View Singapore 018960, Singapore

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Hi Everyone!

It's been 2 years since Kubernetes was open sourced and 1 year since it was announced production ready - more than enough reason to celebrate! GCPUG SG is throwing a Kubernetes birthday party in Singapore! There will be talks and plenty of experts to dig deeper into¬†details.

When:¬†28th of July 2016, Time: 6:30pm
Where: Google, Singapore¬†

please sign up in this Meet Up group AND fill up the Google Form :¬†

https://goo.gl/forms/hZK5qhQmNCrbNVjb2

Agenda :¬†

‚Ä¢¬†6:30 pm - Come on in + networking

‚Ä¢¬†7.00 pm - Welcome and happy birthday Kubernetes ¬†(+ 1.3 Overview) by Hunter Nield, Acaleph

‚Ä¢¬†7.30 pm - Distributed Load Testing with Kubernetes v1.3: Update ¬†by Vincent De Smet, Honestbee

‚Ä¢¬†8.00 pm - k8s on GKE, Vincent Serpoul, Manulife

‚Ä¢¬†8.30 pm - User stories - what is the community up to (Feel free to ping us if you have suggestions for a talk/topic)

‚Ä¢¬†9:00 pm - Stay and mingle!

You will have time to ask questions and relax.

Please let us know if you can make to the event until the 25th of July (deadline RSVP). We do not allow +1, please ask your guests to register and RSVP for the meetup - thank you for your understanding.

To register, please sign up in this Meet Up group AND fill up the Google Form :¬†

https://goo.gl/forms/hZK5qhQmNCrbNVjb2

Due to security of the office premise, only members who filled in the Google Form will be allowed entry.¬†

We are excited to see you at Kubernetes 1st birthday party!

events.name: Kubernetes Workshop @ Block71

venue.name: NUS Enterprise@Blk 71
venue.address_1: 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951, Singapore

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Overview

This 2 hour workshop is for attendees to get started with <a>http://kubernetes.io,</a>; ¬†the leading Container Orchestration framework.¬†

Kubernetes lets you efficiently run applications distributed across a cluster of hosts and keep all services up even in the face of failures.¬†The workshop will cover the basic concepts of Kubernetes.¬†

Did you know ? : ¬†

Pok√©mon GO is one of the most exciting examples of container-based development in the wild. The application logic for the game runs on¬†Google Container Engine (GKE)¬†powered by the open source¬†Kubernetes project. (read Pokemon GO to life on Google Cloud)

We'll start with a short introduction to Docker and container orchestration so participants without prior experience with container technologies can keep up.

Tentative Agenda:

6.15pm to 6.30pm : Light snacks/dinner provided

6.30pm to 9.00pm

‚Ä¢¬†Intro to Linux Containers & Container Orchestration

‚Ä¢¬†Creating a Kubernetes cluster with Container Engine.¬†(optionally a quick overview of Minikube for OSX)

‚Ä¢¬†Overview of the sample application

‚Ä¢¬†Creating container image

‚Ä¢¬†Creating a deployment

‚Ä¢¬†Configuring external load balancing.

‚Ä¢¬†Connecting to the application.

‚Ä¢¬†Scaling the the application.

‚Ä¢¬†Rolling out an upgrade to the application.

‚Ä¢ Troubleshooting the application (if time permits)

‚Ä¢¬†Reviewing the Logs & Monitoring the application (if time permits)

‚Ä¢¬†Observe the Kubernetes Web UI. (if time permits)

Pre-requisites

we will provide additional information with pre-requisites prior to the event.

OSX users may run a single node cluster locally¬†using Minikube.¬†

As part of the demonstration, we will be using a Google Compute Engine account to set up remote cluster managed by Google Container Engine (allowing a consistent environment for everyone to follow along, Windows users will need to have this GCP account).

Attendees who intend to use GCP should ensure their Google Cloud account is ready before the workshop

Link for GCP account set up.

events.name: GCP Data Protection Show Case & GCP Machine learning Demonstration

venue.name: Mapletree business City II
venue.address_1: 70 Pasir Panjang Road #03-01 Singapore 117371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Hello Everybody,

Having challenges in backing up data to cloud securely?

Google Cloud Storage is here to help!

It‚Äôs a simple and cost-effective Object Storage in the Cloud to address customer's data protection and storage requirements.

So let‚Äôs come together for this knowledge sharing session to find out more about the best practice of modern data protection solutions to accelerate organization's business transformation while addressing security and availability concern.

Furthermore, we will also conduct an interactive demo session for you to experience more on Google Cloud Backup and Vision API.

RSVP now! To join us for an informative and interactive evening!

*THERE WILL BE FOOD & BEVERAGES AFTER EVENTS.

----------------------REGISTRATION CLOSED----------------

*Note that due to security of office premise, only members who filled up this Google form will be allowed for entry.

Agenda:
6.30 PM: Registration @ Entrance

7.00 PM: GCP Data Protection Show Case by GCP certified consultant, Lawrence Tay

7.30 PM: GCP Machine Learning Demonstration by GCP certified consultant, Lawrence Tay

8:00 PM: F&B session / Network Session

9:00 PM: End of Events

Description:
1. Application Data Protection to GCP - Extend your application workloads to the cloud securely with cloud-integrated storage which supports both Cloud Storage Standard and Cloud Storage Nearline.

2. GCP Machine Learning Demonstration - Understanding the content of an image has been made easier with Google Cloud Vision API which performs label detection, face detection, landmark detection and even explicit content detection. Hope to see you there!

events.name: Introduction to Machine Learning with TensorFlow

venue.name: Mapletree business City II
venue.address_1: 70 Pasir Panjang Road #03-01 Singapore 117371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Synopsis: Over the past few years, machine learning has gained widespread popularity in a number of disciplines and changed the way we interact and use real-world data to provide insights that are otherwise not directly available for us to leverage.¬†

In this talk, we will have an interactive tutorial session using the Google's TensorFlow to run common operations and further discuss what it takes to design a machine learning algorithm. We will take a look at how to perform prediction using time series data, classify images and text using TensorFlow.

At the same time, to introduce Cloud ML.¬†Google Cloud Machine Learning is a managed service that enables you to easily build machine learning models, that work on any type of data, of any size.

More details will be shared nearer the talk; meanwhile if you have friends/ colleagues who are into machine learning, this session will be interesting for you !

Karthik M Swamy will be leading the talk, he is a machine learning and computer vision researcher.¬†

TensorFlow tutorials to be used in the session are available at:¬†https://github.com/karthikmswamy/TFTutorials

Installation instructions for TensorFlow for different platforms are available at:¬†https://github.com/karthikmswamy/TFTutorials/blob/master/README.md

Useful links :¬†

Tensorflow - http://www.tensorflow.org
Cloud ML -¬†https://cloud.google.com/ml/

This is another 2 hour workshop for attendees to get started with http://kubernetes.io, the leading Container Orchestration framework.¬†

Kubernetes lets you efficiently run applications distributed across a cluster of hosts and keep all services up even in the face of failures. The workshop will cover the basic concepts of Kubernetes.¬†

Did you know?¬†

Pok√©mon GO is one of the most exciting examples of container-based development in the wild. The application logic for the game runs on Google Container Engine (GKE) powered by the open source Kubernetes project. (read Pokemon GO to life on Google Cloud)¬†

We'll start with a short introduction to Docker and container orchestration so participants without prior experience with container technologies can keep up.

‚Ä¢ (if time permits)¬†Troubleshooting the application ¬†

‚Ä¢¬†(if time permits)¬†Reviewing the Logs & Monitoring the application¬†

we will provide additional information with pre-requisites prior to the event.

events.name: //Special// Carousell TechTalk: Scaling Infrastructure at Carousell

venue.name: Carousell HQ
venue.address_1: 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #05-14, Singapore 139951

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Please register at this link to attend :¬†

https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/carousell-techtalk-scaling-infrastructure-at-carousell-tickets-30884512408

DESCRIPTION

Learn how Carousell manages infrastructure to support sustained growth, high levels of uptime, and a variety of use cases. Specifically:

-The journey so far
-Cloud migration
-How we manage configuration for hundreds of servers
-A deployment pipeline that allows quick deployments and rollbacks
-Adoption of new technology such as Kubernetes for smoother deployments and management
-How we manage all data stores in-house with no 3rd-party help in the entire transactional flow.
-Monitoring: our eyes and ears into hundreds of our servers
-How all of the above was put into practice to execute a successful flash sale.

We welcome all engineers (beginner and expert) to join us on Thursday, Jan 12th, at 6.30pm!

Event Programme
6:30pm - 7pm : Registration & Light refreshments
7pm - 8.15pm : Scaling Infrastructure at Carousell by Harshad Rotithor and Ankur Shrivastava
8.15pm - 8.30pm : Q&A

events.name: Recommendation Systems / Engines with TensorFlow

venue.name: Google Asia Pacific
venue.address_1: Mapletree Business City, 70 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 117 371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Recommender Systems / Recommendation Engines - matching right products to right people

Businesses often have the problem of suggesting items to their users due to a large number of items and transaction data. Such suggestions, or recommendations, are paramount to increasing visibility of products, thus leading to more sales, while reducing the information overload on users, making navigation of the items easier. In this talk, we will discuss successful strategies and develop hands-on, a simple recommender system using TensorFlow and Python.¬†

All the code for this talk will be made available on a GitHub repository, the link for which will be shared closer to the date of the meetup. This talk will assume basic knowledge of machine learning, TensorFlow and Python. Audiences are highly recommended to test the code to get a high-level understanding of what to expect from the talk.

Agenda for the day :

Due to a tight agenda, please be here on time ;)

1) Introduction to Recommendation Systems¬†
2) Examples of Recommendation Systems
3) Best Practices for implementing Recommendation Systems¬†
4) Hands on building a simple Recommendation System with TensorFlow
5) Q&A

events.name: Developing a Sentiment Analyser with TensorFlow and Google Cloud NLP

venue.name: Google Asia Pacific
venue.address_1: Mapletree Business City, 70 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 117 371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
In this talk, we continue our journey of using TensorFlow to build an ML solution for text data. We build our application for analysing text and reporting its sentiment.¬†

We'll discuss the theory behind building a sentiment analyser and write our own sentiment analyser using TensorFlow and Google's Cloud NLP API. We will also discuss other capabilities of Google's Cloud NLP API and show how to leverage the API to extend our ML application for other tasks such as identifying people, places and syntax of a sentence to derive insights from unstructured text.¬†

Speaker Bio: Dr Karthik Muthuswamy is a Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning.

To Register, there are 2 steps.

1) Click Yes in this meetup group

2) Fill in this compulsory form -¬†https://goo.gl/forms/VfZwlu4T9muFPw1C3

events.name: Google Cloud OnBoard - Singapore

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
{¬†
Learn how to Build What‚Äôs Next with Google¬†

Register Here :¬†

https://cloudplatformonline.com/2017-OnBoard-APAC.html

}

//Cloud OnBoard is a free full-day instructor-led enablement and training event that will provide you with a step-by-step technical introduction to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Through a combination of instructor-led presentations and hands-on labs, you will learn how to get started with Google App Engine, Datastore, Storage, Container Engine, Compute Engine and Network, Big Data and Machine Learning.

Cloud OnBoard has been designed for IT Managers, Systems Engineers and Operations professionals, Developers, Solution Architects and modern business leaders who are exploring cloud solutions or are new to Google Cloud Platform. Leveraging the GCP Fundamentals course, the event will provide you with the technical training you need to get started as well as access to tips and tricks, industry best-practice and questions and answers from the GCP team.

#Only registered participants can attend. Replying in the meetup group will not be counted.

events.name: Google Cloud Summit, Singapore

venue.name: Raffles City Convention Centre
venue.address_1: 80 Bras Basah Rd Singapore 189560

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
**RSVP'ing at Meetup.com is not sufficient, Please register in the site directly**

Registration is now open for¬†Google Cloud Summit in Singapore¬†on September 21.¬†

This event will bring together business and technical executives, decision makers, architects, developers and system administrators to imagine, learn, and build the future of cloud.

Whether you are just getting started or well into the adoption of cloud computing, Google Cloud Summit is designed to help you create a cost efficient and secure infrastructure, while getting the most out of world class connectivity, data analytics, machine learning and real-time collaboration.

At Google Cloud Summit, you will experience:¬†

15 business and technical sessions on all things cloud, including serverless computing, microservices, big data, databases, analytics, machine learning, data protection, managing APIs, Maps and more.

Keynotes and two tracks of best-practice enablement practices from our engineers, architects and services teams, as well as our customers and partners.

Engage with our network of leading technology partners to accelerate your design, architecture and deployment plans.

You will also have the opportunity to network with your industry peers, Googlers and partners throughout the day.¬†As space is limited and we expect to reach full capacity soon, we encourage you to¬†reserve your seat today.

events.name: Jan '18: Design scalable backend on GCP and continuous integration on GAE

venue.name: Google Asia Pacific
venue.address_1: Mapletree Business City, 70 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 117 371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Happy 2018! We will kickstart the year with 2 interesting topics from the community!

Title: Designing scalable backend for high volume data streaming on GCP using Python, Task Queues and BigQuery

Speaker: Rahul Sharma, Senior Software Engineer, PropertyGuru Singapore

Bio of speaker: Rahul Sharma is an experienced software engineer and has led multiple product development initiatives especially in e-commerce. Currently, he is working as a Senior Software Engineer at PropertyGuru Singapore, prior to this he was the Tech Lead for iPrice Malaysia - an e-commerce aggregation platform. He co-founded MyRent, a premier property rental mobile platform in Malaysia and Singapore in 2014 which is built on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). He is well-versed in PHP, JavaScript and Python development on GCP and has built AMP websites for e-commerce.

Title: App Engine, chatbots and DevOps

Speaker: Yi Jiayu, Student at SUTD

Bio of speaker: Jiayu is a final-year undergraduate student, Information Systems Technology and Design pillar, Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD). He created the Bus ETA chatbot using GCP.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[3:40 p.m - 4:20 p.m] - How should I connect to the cloud? An introduction to dedicated connectivity by Filippo, Solutions Architect of Megaport(APAC)
[4:20 p.m - 4:50 p.m] - Triggering analytics workloads with serverless functions by Hairizuan Bin Noorazman, Backend Engineer, Acronis & Co-organizer GCPUG meetup group
[5:00 p.m - 5:30 p.m] - Networking

events.name: [ONLINE] DevFest On Air 2018

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
We‚Äôre excited to announce the first official DevFest OnAir! DevFest OnAir is an online conference featuring sessions from DevFest events around the globe. These community-led developer sessions are hosted by GDG (Google Developer Groups) focused on community, networking and learning about Google technologies. With over 500 communities and DevFest events happening all over the world, DevFest OnAir brings this global experience online for the first time!

This is an online event, register here: https://devfest.withgoogle.com/events/devfestonair18#

events.name: BigQuery and Solving GDPR with Machine Learning

venue.name: Google Asia Pacific
venue.address_1: 70, Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Welcome to the first GCPUG talk for year 2019!

There are 3 talks for this session

[Talk 1]
Topic: Using Machine Learning to meet Data Privacy requirements.

Speaker: Jason Quek from Avalon Solutions

Synoposis: General Data Protection Regulation states that European citizens have the right to request for access to their personal data, and that photos of themselves are considered personal data. With a large database of photos, companies run the risk of running afoul of regulations which can cost many millions in fines.
During this session, we will demonstrate how we use Machine Learning to solve this problem at different levels through facial recognition models and categorization of unstructured data, e.g. DNS entries.
As data privacy becomes a larger issue in Singapore, some of the techniques can be reused to ensure that data breaches can be detected and not compromised.

[Talk 2]
Topic: Using BigQuery for Large Data Processing

Speaker: Nito Buendia, Customer Solution Engineer Google
Bio: Nito is a Customer Solutions Engineer at Google; working on building scalable automation and data solutions for Google's largest advertisers. During his tenure at Google, he has mainly focused on Automation and delivering solutions for teams to operate at 10x scale. He is passionate about empowering businesses through digitization and technology.

Sypnosis: BigQuery is Google Cloud's highly scalable, enterprise-ready data warehouse; which will allow you to focus on analyzing large data sets without worrying about the infrastructure. On this session, we will learn what BigQuery is and the benefits that can bring to your business and data projects. We will also explore some enterprise architecture examples and showcase how you can optimize and improve the performance of analyses.

[Talk 3]
Topic: Responsible AI Practices: Fairness in ML

Speaker:
Bio: Andrew Zaldivar is a Developer Advocate for Google AI. His job is to help to bring the benefits of AI to everyone. Andrew develops, evaluates, and promotes tools and techniques that can help communities build responsible AI systems, writing posts for the Google Developers blog and speaking at a variety of conferences. Before joining Google AI, Andrew was a Senior Strategist in Google‚Äôs Trust & Safety group and worked on protecting the integrity of some of Google‚Äôs key products by using machine learning to scale, optimize and automate abuse-fighting efforts. Prior to joining Google, Andrew completed his Ph.D. in Cognitive Neuroscience from the University of California, Irvine and was an Insight Data Science fellow.

Sypnosis: AI systems are enabling new experiences and abilities for people around the globe. The risk is that any unfairness in such systems can also have a wide-scale impact. Thus, as the impact of AI increases across sectors and societies, it is critical to work towards systems that are fair and inclusive for all. This talk will share some of our current work and recommended practices for building fairer and more inclusive AI systems.

[Additional Information]
For a more organized QnA session, we would be using this tool provided by this website:
https://www.sli.do/
Go to the website and type the code: GCPUGSG
events.how_to_find_us: Head to level 3 at the guest entrance

events.name: Delivering software; Hopefully without bugs

venue.name: Google Asia Pacific
venue.address_1: 70, Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
There are 3 talks for this session!!

We would probably start the talk promptly at 7pm as there 3 pretty meaty topics so try to reach the location as fast as you can

[Talk 1]
Topic: Knative
Speaker: Mete Atamel, Senior Developer Advocate - Google Cloud
Mete is a Developer Advocate at Google, focused on helping developers with Google Cloud. As a long-time Java and C# developer, he likes to compare the two ecosystems. Prior to Google, he worked at Microsoft, Skype, Adobe, EMC, and Nokia building apps and services on various web, mobile and cloud platforms. Originally from the island of Cyprus, he currently lives in Greenwich of London, not too far away from the prime meridian.

Sypnosis: When you build a serverless app, you either tie yourself to a cloud provider, or you end up building your own serverless stack. Knative provides a better choice. Knative extends Kubernetes to provide a set of middleware components (build, serving, events) for modern, source-centric, and container-based apps that can run anywhere. In this talk, we‚Äôll see how we can use Knative primitives to build a serverless app that utilizes the Machine Learning magic of the cloud.

[Talk 2]
Topic: Devops, Secops & QA - and its future consolidation for commercial software
Speaker: Eugene Cheah, CTO & cofounder at Uilicious
Been working for over 12 years on various web technologies, and throwing them into production.
Now with a focus on automating user journey web testing of other web platforms, at scale with Uilicious. Helping companies, from startups such as Glints, to major enterprises with SAP.

Sypnosis: Looking into a possible future where where devops, secops & QA consolidates into a single delivery team, and will it mean for all of us.

[Talk 3]
Topic: Live Kubernetes Debugging with the Elastic Stack
Speaker: Aravind Putrevu, Developer Advocate, Elastic

Sypnosis: Your Kubernetes app is down. Your users start ranting on Twitter. Your boss is standing right behind you. What do you do?

This talk walks you through a live debugging session without panicking:
What do your health checks say?
Where does your monitoring point you?
Can you get more details from your application's traces?
Is there anything helpful in the logs?
What the heck is even deployed?

We're having a little collab event with the Kubernetes meetup group for this meetup. If you are interested in all things Kubernetes; you should follow them on this meetup group: https://www.meetup.com/Singapore-Kubernetes-User-Group

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam - Kubernetes

venue.name: Google Asia Pacific
venue.address_1: 70, Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117371

group.name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.description:
Google Cloud study jams are community organised hands-on workshops educating participants on Google Cloud Technologies. As the first study jam of GCPUGSG, we are planning to have `Kubernetes in the Google Cloud` (https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/29) conducted by facilitators who have experience in K8s. The qwiklab credits that is required to take the study jam will be provided during the session.

Pre-requisites:
* Basic Linux commands
* Docker basics (https://www.docker.com/)
events.how_to_find_us: Come to level 3 @ Google Singapore Developer Relations Space
